page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY OF WITHERNWICK
page.content:
Local History items about Withernwick
There has been a parish church in Withernwick since at least the beginning of the 12th century. In 1855 the rebuilding of the church was completed at a cost of Â£1,305. The Methodist(Wesleyan)Chapel was built in 1810 and the present building is the one that was rebuilt in 1914. The Methodist Sunday School was built in 1845 and is still in use. The school in Withernwick is another old building part of which was built in 1846, but even before that date it is known that a Free School existed for 17 poor children. This school was supported by the Lord of the Manor,R.Bethell Esq.
